context: Hello! What kind of movies do you like?
Oh, those are great! If you are in the mood for an old-school movie, I would recommend Die Hard (1988) .
And movies with dark comedies like Juno (2007)
If you want something more recent, there is that movie with the train called Unstoppable (2013) .
I have seen it, it's great!
Juno (2007) was great, too. If you don't mind gore, one of my favorite dark movies is Fargo (1996) .
although Saw (2003) change the all terror type of movies Fargo (1996) is great!!
resp: Yes, I agree. I am not a huge fan of Saw (2004) to be honest. I don't mind gore, but that one was just gore for gore's sake, if that makes sense. I guess I'm getting old.

context.content: Hello
Hi! What kind of movies do you like?
I like movies that are funny, emotional, and family-friendly. Do you have any recommendations for me?
context.feelings: I hope the recommender understands my preferences and recommends a movie that truly matches what I'm looking for. I don't want to be disappointed again.

context.content: I love comedies! Have you seen The Hangover (2009)?
I haven't seen The Hangover. Can you tell me more about it?
context.feelings: I'm a bit disappointed that the recommender suggested a comedy like "The Hangover." It's funny, but it's not emotional or family-friendly. I wish they understood my preferences better.

context.content: It's about a group of friends who have to go out to eat and end up in a lot of trouble. It's pretty funny. It has Adam Sandler and Vince Vaughn. It is about a bunch of friends going out to have a great time. It also has some really funny moments.
That sounds fun, but I was hoping for something with a bit more depth and heart. Do you have any recommendations that are also emotional and family-friendly?
context.feelings: I'm a bit disappointed that the recommended movie is just a comedy. I was hoping for something that's also emotional and family-friendly. The recommender seems to be enthusiastic about comedies, but I need something more than just humor. I wish they understood my preferences better.

context.content: Have you ever seen The Proposal (2009)? It's a great comedy with Adam Sandlers and Vince Vaughan. It really has a lot to it.
The Proposal sounds interesting. Can you tell me more about it?
context.feelings: I was hoping for a movie that is not only funny but also emotional and family-friendly. The recommended movies seem to focus more on humor and may not have the depth and heartwarming elements I'm looking for. The recommender seems enthusiastic about comedies, but I wish they understood my preference for a more well-rounded movie. I hope the next recommendation will be a better fit for me.
